==Commercialization==
==Commercialization==
â
Intel's My WiFi solution provides the Wi-Fi Direct technology on the Centrino 2 CPU. <ref>[http://download.intel.com/network/connectivity/products/wireless/320875.pdf Welcome to the Freedom of Portable Wi-Fi], Intel My WiFi Pocket Book</ref> Wi-Fi Direct devices can connect to a notebook computer that plays the role of a Soft AP. The notebook computer can then provide Internet access to the Wi-Fi Direct-enabled devices without a Wi-Fi AP. Atheros, Broadcom, Intel, Ralink and Realtek announced their first products in October, 2010.<ref>[http://www.informationweek.com/news/infrastructure/remote_access/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=227900741&subSection=News Wi-Fi Direct Products Connect Without A Network]</ref> [[Redpine Signals]]' chipset is Wi-Fi Direct certified in November,2010.<ref>[http://redpinesignals.com/News/Press_releases/2010-November9.html Redpine Signalsâ Lite-FiÂ® â Ultra Low Power 802.11n â RS9110 Chipset Achieves Wi-Fi Directâ¢ Certification]</ref> Google announced Wi-fi Direct support in Android 4.0 in October, 2011.<ref>[http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html#UserFeatures Android 4 at developer.android.com]</ref>
+
Intel's My WiFi solution provides the Wi-Fi Direct technology on the Centrino 2 CPU. <ref>[http://download.intel.com/network/connectivity/products/wireless/320875.pdf Welcome to the Freedom of Portable Wi-Fi], Intel My WiFi Pocket Book</ref> Wi-Fi Direct devices can connect to a notebook computer that plays the role of a Soft AP. The notebook computer can then provide Internet access to the Wi-Fi Direct-enabled devices without a Wi-Fi AP. Atheros, Broadcom, Intel, Ralink and Realtek announced their first products in October, 2010.<ref>[http://www.informationweek.com/news/infrastructure/remote_access/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=227900741&subSection=News Wi-Fi Direct Products Connect Without A Network]</ref> [[Redpine Signals]]' chipset is Wi-Fi Direct certified in November,2010.<ref>[http://redpinesignals.com/News/Press_releases/2010-November9.html Redpine Signalsâ Lite-FiÂ® â Ultra Low Power 802.11n â RS9110 Chipset Achieves Wi-Fi Directâ¢ Certification]</ref> Google announced Wi-fi Direct support in [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 4.0 in October, 2011<ref>[http://developer.android.com/sdk/android-4.0-highlights.html#UserFeatures Android 4 at developer.android.com]</ref> and with the first Android device to ship with the feature being the [[Galaxy Nexus]].
